text: Crossbench MP Zali Steggall says we “need to put a legislative framework for Australia to set in law what we need to do, not just in terms of action on climate change, but preparing for climate change”. Ms Steggall told Sky News she wants “an independent advisory committee” to report on and advise the government on meeting long-term goals towards acting on climate change. “The government is adamantly saying we’re going to meet our 2030 targets, but the science community says we’re not,” she said. The crossbench MP said on Thursday she does not want to “wait until 2030" to find out if the government's climate targets have been met. Image: News Corp Australia
